Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, good location, reasonable rooms”
Reviews.Author: Adrian G
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 6 nights taking 4 rooms for our family while visiting Paris for a wedding. Overall we were very pleased. The rooms are functional but clean and well maintained and of reasonable size (small but ok) for a capital city. The hotel is very well located and the staff were friendly and helpful. We would be very happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean”
Reviews.Author: cermer
Reviews.Content: We go to Paris every year for the sales and stay @ du continent every time. It is a clean hotel with free wifi. The rooms are not too small (except for the single person room that my mother had to stay one night and changed) The staff knows english and helps you with your reservations needs. The price is also very good if you book in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, great price, average room!”
Reviews.Author: leighmur
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights @ the Hotel du Continent. Can't beat the location - block away from the Tuileres garden; less than 5 minute walk to the closest Metro. Staff nice, room average - clean and nothing fancy. Good price for location!

Reviews.Title: “Clean. Everything else TERRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: ashfordcoupleKent
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews having already booked this hotel and stupidly thought maybe it had been refurbished and the problems were sorted. NO. We booked a "superior room with Queen bed" nearly four weeks in advance. We chose this hotel because it claimed to have parking. They emailed to confirm the booking and to say parking was nearby in car park 25€ daily. Where do I start, it is NOT romantic. The desk woman barely looked at us as she reviewed our booking and handed the key over. Our room had two 2'6" singled pushed together and just about room to walk around it (room44). We went straight back down to say we had booked a superieur room with a Queen bed - she replied it was a superieur room.Hmm? We were given another room which was the same but had an additional area with a single bed also (room 52). The reviews are right - there is absolutely NO sound proofing - you will hear everything and the smell of smoke does indeed fill your room through the ceiling vents if you have smokers above you. Upstairs checked out at 8.30 am on Sunday having clomped aorund for at least an hour. Ahhh we thought, sleep. NO. The cleaner arrived upstairs to hoover and another in the room opposite - both VERY NOISY. The room was cold, barren, no frills, but it was clean. Great location but dont expect to see it out the windows. Construction and high buildings around mean you dont see anything really. There is car parking nearby but not as close as would be nice. In summary - great hotel if you are deaf, single and a chain smoker. miss

Reviews.Title: “Nice, simple, clean stay”
Reviews.Author: rosefarmer
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel. Perfect esp. when you're going to be out all day and don't need something very fancy and elegant, but want something clean and pleasant. Lots of closet space - area with beds was small but again, workable. Very nice staff and great location.

Reviews.Title: “le thieves”
Reviews.Author: nemocork
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel for 2 nights. on the first night we went for a nice trip around the sights my wife left her handbag in the room .we were gone for four hours while we were out our room was robbed.my wifes money and jewellery was taken;we didnt notice it until the next morning.we went straight to the receptionist who tookk no notice of us.she phoned the manager who was just as bad.we reported it to the police.they were nice enough.they filed a report and we had to bring it back to the hotel.our stay in this hotel was one rotten experience.all you people out there heading to paris avoid this hotel like the plague.a rotten hotel with horrible staff.

Reviews.Title: “Small, quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: Highgater1
Reviews.Content: Lovely, small hotel just off Rue de Rivoli. Very comfortable and staff were very friendly. Room size & Bathroom/toilet were reasonable size by Paris standards. Hotel is also close to the metro and about 10-15mins walk to the Lourve. The only downside is that the room heating was turned up but even adjusting it down, nothing seems to change. We eventually turned it off at night.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ribarci
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed in this hotel July 2006 for 1 week. The room was clean but very small and decor was tastefull but the elevator was tiny where only 1 person can fit with their luggage. The biggest problem was that they are THEIVES! One morning my partner and I went out to breakfast and I left my Gucci sunglasses in our room. I had left them by the bed only to find that house keeping had come into our room and my sunglasses were GONE! The receptionist kept on saying that maybe we had forgotten them somwhere else or they are maybe somwhere in our luggage even after I explained that we had only been gone for 30 minutes and that I purposly left them next to the bed so I don't forget to take them after breakfast. We talked to the owner also and she was so RUDE that she threatened to call the police for false accusations and said she was taking the house keepers side beacuse she knows her for 20 years. We had no componsation or sympathy from staff. I would never stay here again.!!!! There are much better hotels nearby such as Hotel Mayfair.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: princessmartine
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel over New year 2006. It was in a great location, and although it was a little small it was very clean and comfortable. The only bad thing was the walls were a little thin, you could hear people walking past the room, but we never found this a problem. The rooms were very hot, a godsend in december and january! The breakfast wasnt up to much at only a Criossant and Cerial for around 13 Euro. The staff were extremely helpful if we needed anything, like plugs or directions! Would definately recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location. Professional staff. Eat two doors down at a great little place and skip the breakfast at this place VERY CLEAN AND NEWLY REMODELED.

Reviews.Title: “The City Center”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: From the history, to the food, to the (opposite to what you may have heard) friendly people, Paris is our absolute favorite place in Europe. We arrived by train from Cologne, Germany and took a short metro trip to the HOTEL DU CONTINENT in the 1st district, one block from the Jardin des Tuileries. The hotel was perfectly located in the city center and modestly priced as well. Even though there were a few mishaps (our train from Cologne had some "technical difficulties", as did our hotel elevator), we made sure to hit the major Parisian monuments: the Louvre, the Arc de Triomphe, strolling the Champs Elysees, the Hotel National des Invalides, a Seine river tour, the Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame, the Basilique du Sacre Coeur, and the Moulin Rouge to name a few. We figured we must have walked about 10 miles each day we were there, so THANK GOODNESS we were able to keep our strength up with croissants and crepes! If you haven't been, you really must visit Paris. Hopefully, the pictures will inspire someone to go, because I know we're going back!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had an absolute fantastic weekend away in paris.The hotel is right slap bang in the middle if paris..we found it very easily as its off one of the main roads.After checking in.. just said "je m`appelle Claudine" and my key was handed to my with a big smile with directions to the lift..simple! we decided to go for a stroll to get our barings and 2 minutes after leaving the hotel there we were in the jardin des tuileries gazing at the Louvre in one direction and in the other was the place de la concorde... looking onto des champs elysees with the arc de triomphe!! we were blown away with the beauty of the city. The location of the hotel is fantastic we couldn`t believe it.. The staff were very friendly and eager to help if they could. the Room was a fine size very clean and brightly decorated. The area itself was a bit pricey but we found a lovely Pub just a stone throw from the Hotel called Carrs and it served lovely food and drink that was very affordable compared to a few other places we`d been. The cheapest pint in paris is on the 1 etage of the Eiffel tower â‚¬3.60!! If you are a picky eater then it is much advised to bring some food and keep it in the fridge in your room. All in all we had a fantastic time!

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient Location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: roskee08
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a great stay in Paris and wanted to share my hotel experience. First of all, the hotel is a great location for sightseeing in Paris. You are in the 1st district, which is walking distance to the Louvre, the Tuillieres, etc. - and you are right near the Siene, making it easy to pop right over the bridge to the Left Bank. We walked everwhere - to Sacred Heart, Galleries Lafayette - we rarely took cabs (only when super shopped-out) and even the Metro was easy from the hotel. The neighborhood of the hotel is pretty cute, too, lots of boutiques in the area, and lots of good shopping only a block away on Rue du Honore. As for the hotel itself, it is very small. there are only six floors and the elevator (also small!) only goes to the 5th floor, so you will need to walk up a small flight of stairs to get to the 6th floor, which is where we stayed. there were only four rooms on the 6th floor, and maybe 6-8 rooms on the other floors We had a Standard room, and it was quite small. Mercifully we weren't there much, because if so it would have been pretty tight. I would recommend getting a Superior-sized room just to have a little more space. Generally speaking the room was clean and the bathroom was pretty clean. housekeeping came in each day and left fresh towels, which was nice, not all hotels do that without you specifically requesting them to do so. Water was hot, and the shower water pressure was good. The hotel was recently renovated so the bathroom fixtures are pretty modern. Note: there were no face towels in the room, only hand towels and bath towels. this is pretty common in Europe, so if you want a face towel you might want to bring your own. There is a mini bar in the room and a small desk. the TV has a random smattering of channels, but there is CNN and that's what we found ourselves watching for the most part. TRUE: the walls are paper thin - maybe thinner than paper.... You will pretty much hear the comings and goings of your neighbors, so be prepared for that. The first couple of days were annoying because clearly we were not on the same schedule as our floormates but then it got better but that's because i'm assuming they checked out. Another thing: there are no in-room safes. they have a safe downstairs and you can store your items there, but you can only access the safe from 8am to 8pm. if you like your things in your room in your own safe, this is not the hotel for you. They do have a converter which converts the plug and the electric current, you just have to request it at the front desk (also from 8am-8pm). We paid 107 euro per night (a "Spring" deal that we got by seeing it on their website and then calling them directly), which was a good rate, i'm not sure i'd pay too much more for it. We're super-picky about hotels but generally speaking i think most would be happy with it. But again, if you are there to see Paris and not the walls of your room, then the location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: j'adoreparis
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers clean, affordable accommodations in a great location. The only drawback is the thin walls...you can hear the people next to you crystal clear, so if you're a light sleeper this might be a problem. Other than that, for the price and location, Hotel du Continent is a great find.

Reviews.Title: “Best value on the Right Bank!”
Reviews.Author: Stephen_F_Smith
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Paris. C'est magnifique! The Hotel du Continent has it all -- an unbeatable location, clean (and, by Paris standards, sizable) rooms, and rates that are incredibly affordable in the 1st arrondissement. The hotel is on a quiet side street just off the rue de Rivoli, the street that leads to the Tuilieries and the Louvre Museum. Within a five or six block radius, you have most of the major Right Bank sites, including the following: the Louvre (3 blocks), the Tuilieries (1 block), Place de Concorde (1 block), Place Vendome (1 block), and the Church of La Madeleine (4 blocks). The Marais is roughly 10 blocks away, which we walked. We started every day there with hot chocolate and pasteries at Angelina's -- a must, just 2 blocks from the hotel -- and walked to the Louvre through the Tuileries. For more distant sites on the Right Bank, such as the Basilica of Sacre Coeur and Monmartre generally, there are two subway stations within 2 blocks of the hotel (Concorde and Tuilieries) and there's a taxi stand at the Place Vendome (1 block away). Despite all this in such close proximity to the hotel, the hotel is very quiet, without even a hint that you're smack dab in the middle of a crowded city. The hotel staff were helpful with directions and reservations, and spoke good English. Unlike others staying elsewhere in Paris, our belongings were completely secure while we were away. You can't go wrong with the Hotel du Continent. Unless the rates go up dramatically, we'll definitely be back! Au revoir!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel du Continent
HotelInfo.Address: 30, rue du Mont-Thabor | 1 Arr, 75001 Paris, France
